content.body: I wonder if Parser Augmentation would make more sense to people if I described it more as "asm.js for the parser" than as "transpilers for the runtime" ðŸ¤”
because it's the same kind of concept - ES code that _can_ be executed at runtime without penalty, but is _intended_ to be statically internalized

content.body: and it doesn't need TC39 buy-in any more than asm.js did, but the process of writing my own prototype implementation into V8 is reconfirming to me that having expert input on the design from the start will make implementation and integration much easier if and when it _does_ get to runtime engines
content.formatted_body: and it doesn't need TC39 buy-in any more than asm.js did, but the process of writing my own prototype implementation into V8 is reconfirming to me that having expert input on the design from the start will make implementation and integration much easier if and when it does get to runtime engines
